alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Union (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 5:31AM MDT until further notice by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota... Big Sioux River at Sioux Falls I-90 affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River near Brookings affecting Moody and Brookings Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... South Dakota...Minnesota... Big Sioux River at Brandon affecting Lyon, Minnehaha and Lincoln Counties. Big Sioux River near Estelline affecting Hamlin and Brookings Counties. Medary Creek near Medary affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River near Bruce affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River near Canton affecting Lyon, Sioux and Lincoln Counties. Big Sioux River at Akron affecting Plymouth and Union Counties. Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River above Hawarden affecting Lincoln, Sioux and Union Counties. Sixmile Creek near Brookings affecting Brookings County. Rock River near Hardwick affecting Rock County. Rock River at Rock Rapids affecting Lyon County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sioux River above Hawarden. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, some farm houses on the South Dakota side of the river are isolated by high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 22.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 AM CDT Tuesday was 22.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to near 24.0 feet this afternoon and remain near those levels until Friday before slowly falling. - Flood stage is 20.5 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Big Sioux River Hawarden 20.5 22.6 Tue 5 am 23.5 23.2 23.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late Tuesday morning.
